ovdesc.p: Statistics are calculated during end of period processing. The quantities accumulated are:
- Amount in each currency (only if Currency is one of the selection criteria)
- Time taken to deliver the message (from application hand-off to being successfully handed to the carrier)

These totals include all messages, or only those where particular conditions apply. The Statistics Table is used to define the conditions for which statistics should be maintained and the sequence in which they should be presented.

A Statistics Table record is set up for each statistics report required. For the collection of statistics the ID of a record is unimportant because all Delivery Statistics records are checked with each message to see if the message should be added into the statistics totals. A careful choice of IDs will be helpful, however, when using the resulting reports.

Statistical totals are not set to zero by the End of Period processing, this is done when the report is printed. (Reports can be viewed on line at any time without being zeroised.) This enables the statistics to accrue through several periods, thus reports that are printed weekly will contain weekly totals; reports printed monthly will contain monthly totals. It would be advisable to assign a different range of numbers for the IDS of daily, weekly and monthly reports so that reports are not printed before their due date.
Statistics table records are set up containing multivalue sets of:

Complex conditions can be built by setting up several simple conditions in a multivalue set. All the conditions must be true for the combined condition to apply. Where the Operand and Condition are omitted the field name indicates the sequence of the report.

The user might choose to select urgent messages for customer number 1234 and to display the totals primarily in order of currency code and then, within each Currency Code, by Message Type. To achieve this a Statistics Table record is set up as follows:

Field name 1 CURRENCY (No operand or condition) Field name 2 MESSAGE.TYPE (No operand or condition) Field name 3 MESSAGE.PRIORITY Operand 3 EQUAL Condition 3 U Field name 4 CUSTOMER Operand 4 EQUAL Condition 4 1234

Note that the report generated would contain separate totals for each Message Type within each Currency, but no overall total (for all Message Types) by Currency. To obtain these an additional record is required as follows:
Field name 1 CURRENCY (No operand or condition) Field name 2 MESSAGE.PRIORITY Operand 2 EQUAL Condition 2 U Field name 3 CUSTOMER Operand 3 EQUAL Condition 3 1234

Note : For improved performance, put the least common selection parameter first, i.e. the one that will exclude most records. For example, if there are fewer records with a priority of 'U' than messages for customer 1234, specify the priority selection before the customer selection.
